soilMoistureReadings.recommendations: Your soil is very dry. Water your crops immediately to prevent them from drying out.

soilMoistureReadings.interpretation: Soil is dry, and plants might show signs of water stress
soilMoistureReadings.recommendations: The soil is dry, and your plants may start wilting. It's a good time to water them.
The soil is a bit dry. Water your crops soon to keep them healthy.
Your soil has the perfect amount of moisture. Keep up the good work and water as usual.

soilMoistureReadings.interpretation: Soil is moist, monitor signs of overwatering
soilMoistureReadings.recommendations: The soil is nicely moist. Keep an eye on it and avoid watering too much.

soilMoistureReadings.interpretation: Soil is wet enough, reduce watering
soilMoistureReadings.recommendations: The soil is already wet. Cut back on watering to avoid problems.

soilMoistureReadings.interpretation: The soil is holding excess water
soilMoistureReadings.recommendations: The soil has too much water. Let it dry out before watering again.
There is too much water in the soil. Stop watering until it dries out a bit.
